c:capability.name: Device
c:capability.c:description: Base device capabilities shared by all devices.

c:attribute.name: account
c:attribute.description: Driver-owned account associated with the device

c:attribute.name: place
c:attribute.description: Driver-owned place where the device is currently located

c:attribute.name: devtypehint
c:attribute.description: Device Details screen that should be used to view this device

c:attribute.name: name
c:attribute.description: Human readable name for the device

c:attribute.name: productId
c:attribute.description: ID of the product catalog that describes this device

c:method.name: ListHistoryEntries
c:method.description: Returns a list of all the history log entries associated with this device

c:parameter.name: limit
c:parameter.description: The maximum number of events to return (defaults to 10)

c:parameter.name: token
c:parameter.description: The token from a previous query to use for retrieving the next set of results

c:return.name: nextToken
c:return.description: The token to use for getting the next page, if null there is no next page

c:return.name: results
c:return.description: The entries associated with this device

c:method.name: Remove
c:method.description: Attempts to remove the given device. This call will return immediately to give the user removal steps, but the caller should watch for a base:Deleted event to be emitted from the Device. This call is safe to retry, but if a notfound error is returned that indicates a previous call already succeeded. This may put the hub in unpairing mode depending on the device being removed.

c:parameter.name: timeout
c:parameter.description: The number of milliseconds that device removal is expected for. Defaults to 5 minutes if not specified.

c:return.name: steps
c:return.description: The removal steps for the given device. Will be empty for devices that support autonomous removal.

c:return.name: video
c:return.description: The URL for a removal video.

c:method.name: ForceRemove
c:method.description: Sent to request that a device be removed.

c:event.name: DeviceConnected
c:event.description: Sent when a device comes online. This may be very specific to the given protocol and require client interpretation.

c:event.name: DeviceDisconnected
c:event.description: Sent when a device goes offline. This may be very specific to the given protocol and require client interpretation. Not all drivers will be able to detect this event.

c:event.name: DeviceRemoved
c:event.description: Sent when a device is removed.
